medical_history.chief_complaint: Congenital sensorineural hearing loss and goiter consistent with Pendred's syndrome.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Hearing impairment is bilateral and typically congenital, with severity varying from severe to profound. Goiter typically develops in late childhood to early adulthood. Symptoms of hypothyroidism, including elevated serum TSH levels, were observed early in life.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Congenital primary hypothyroidism diagnosed with elevated TSH levels; management included thyroid hormone replacement therapy. Hearing loss evaluated starting from 2 years of age.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal history of goiter and a maternal aunt and paternal uncle reported to be hypothyroid. Family history suggests hereditary predisposition to Pendred's syndrome.
